channel.title: [VB6] Snake game with updater and difficulty
channel.description:
Well, im making a Snake game with updater and difficulty, im thinking about making more updates for it and stuff, but im not sure if i do that, so please vote.
Snake 1.0 pictures:
Launcher: [img]http://i54.tinypic.com/2m5bjx3.jpg[/img]
Game: [img]http://i56.tinypic.com/2ue0mqq.jpg[/img]
Virus scan picture: (Its dutch, sorry for that) [img]http://i56.tinypic.com/16ia8gk.jpg[/img]
Download link: http://www.mediafire.com/?bquldiobv4sxi4n
Note: Install the game to Program Files, the installer will make a shortcut on your destkop.
Feature updates:
-Music and other sounds -Highscores -Shop
[b]If you got a suggestion to add to the game, please leave a comment and mabey ill add it :)[/b]
Last updates:
1.2: -Added Slowmotion (Buyable for 3500 points) -Changed price from bonus xp to 3000 points
1.1: -Added bonus xp (Buyable for 600 points)
1.0: -Game just came out -Added score -Added difficulty -Added updater

item.title: [VB6] Snake game with updater and difficulty
item.dc:creator: @enzo42 enzo42
item.description:
@enzo42 wrote:

[quote=“B2300 T4nk, post:15, topic:403449”][quote author=enzo42 link=topic=500512.msg3661784#msg3661784 date=1310401780]

You can get sued for making this game. My dad once made Tetris and he got sued.

You cant get sued for making Snake i think, i mean why should it be illegal to make snake, and legal to make nazi zombies from black ops
[/quote]Snake is copyrighted. Hurr durr.[/quote]

black ops is also copyrighted

Read full topic

item.title: [VB6] Snake game with updater and difficulty
item.dc:creator: @Racist_Turtle Racist Turtle
item.description:
@Racist_Turtle wrote:

[quote=“Tu, post:5, topic:403449”][quote author=Racist Turtle link=topic=500512.msg3660323#msg3660323 date=1310327382]
Not a bad game to start out with. However, I don’t agree with VB6 (If that makes any sense), I feel like Visual Basic is in some sense making people believe they are legit programmers when VB6 is just making things a whole lot easier then they really are, not saying that’s a bad thing. You should learn how to do it from scratch FIRST, and not take for granted what VB does.

You can continue with VB, however I do recommend that you move on to more advanced, high-level languages.

PS: Put up a scan picture, .exe files cannot be trusted.
[/quote]
well if you think about it java is an easier alternative to C and C/++ is an alternative to using an even lower level language - like assembly. so if you think about it even more, java and C/++ shouldn’t be used because it’s just making programming easier.[/quote]

True, it’s just an opinion I’ve developed about VB6 though. It’s a smart idea I think for someone to learn how something works (obviously that may be tedious and annoying work), but depending on the result from that, when you do move on to things that make it a whole lot easier to do said-task, you at least have the background knowledge of how that task came to be.

Read full topic
item.source: [VB6] Snake game with updater and difficulty

well if you think about it java is an easier alternative to C and C/++ is an alternative to using an even lower level language - like assembly. so if you think about it even more, java and C/++ shouldn’t be used because it’s just making programming easier.

[quote=“enzo42, post:3, topic:403449”][quote author=Racist Turtle link=topic=500512.msg3660323#msg3660323 date=1310327382]
Not a bad game to start out with. However, I don’t agree with VB6 (If that makes any sense), I feel like Visual Basic is in some sense making people believe they are legit programmers when VB6 is just making things a whole lot easier then they really are, not saying that’s a bad thing. You should learn how to do it from scratch FIRST, and not take for granted what VB does.

You can continue with VB, however I do recommend that you move on to more advanced, high-level languages.

PS: Put up a scan picture, .exe files cannot be trusted.
[/quote]

I tried c++, and made my first Warrock hack, but i dont think im going to make other programs in that one, i like vb6 :D, and ill add scan picture give me a min :)[/quote]

Whatever floats your boat, that’s fine, hell for all I know I could be talking to a person who will revolutionize VB6 and the programs that come out of it.

Read full topic
